definitions.definition: A person united with another or others in an act, enterprise, or business; a partner.
Somebody with whom one works, coworker, colleague.
One that habitually accompanies or is associated with another; an attendant circumstance.
A member of an institution or society who is granted only partial status or privileges.

One of a pair of elements of an integral domain (or a ring) such that the two elements are divisible by each other (or, equivalently, such that each one can be expressed as the product of the other with a unit).
To join in or form a league, union, or association.
To spend time socially; keep company.
definitions.example: She associates with her coworkers on weekends.

definitions.definition: (with with) To join as a partner, ally, or friend.
definitions.example: He associated his name with many environmental causes.

definitions.definition: To connect or join together; combine.
definitions.example: particles of gold associated with other substances

definitions.definition: To connect evidentially, or in the mind or imagination.
To accompany; to be in the company of.
Joined with another or others and having lower status.
definitions.example: The associate editor is someone who has some experience in editing but not sufficient experience to qualify for a senior post.
He is an associate member of the club.
associate motions: those that occur sympathetically, in consequence of preceding motions
